Specially selected for their superb flavour

The best the world has to offer As a stone fruit season ends in one country, it begins in another. Which is why we follow the harvest around the world, selecting different varieties, to bring you the best quality fresh stone fruit. Robert Graaff is one of our selected growers, whose peaches have been carefully nurtured to full maturity in a region renowned for the high quality and flavour of its fruit. Perfectly ripe fruit is selected from our best sources around the world and ripened for you to enjoy on the first day of purchase

The best the world has to offer As a stone fruit season ends in one country, it begins in another. Which is why we follow the harvest around the world, selecting different varieties, to bring you the best quality fresh stone fruit. Pierre Riou is one of our selected growers, whose passion and dedication to the family business of breeding new apricots and plums has helped Waitrose to continually bring you the newest varieties to enjoy. To ripen fruit, leave at room temperature for 1-2 days or place in a paper bag with a ripe banana until the fruit yields slightly to pressure. Then store in a fridge until required, and return to room temperature before eating to enjoy at its best.

LEAF Logo From carefully selected farmers who share our values and commitment. For further information go to waitrose.com and www.leafmarque.com. A spicy, aromatic herb, delicious added to baked vegetables, soups, marinades and stuffings. Use whole and remove before serving, or strip off the leaves, finely chop and add during cooking Why not try... Lemon Thyme. With a zesty citrus aroma, delicious sprinkled over vegetables or used in stuffings. Perfect with fish and poultry

LEAF Logo From carefully selected farmers who share our values and commitment. For further information go to waitrose.com and www.leafmarque.com. With a wonderful flavour combining zesty citrus and aromatic thyme. Simply strip the leaves from the stem and sprinkle over vegetables before cooking. Delicious with fish, white meats and in stuffings Why not try... Tarragon. Its mild aniseed flavour goes perfectly with chicken dishes, sauces and salads. Wonderful blended with butter

Facebook.com/sensationscrisp

No MSG and hydrogenated fats. Not genetically modified. Suitable for vegetarians. Wasabi pea Asian fire snacks. Hisaki peas are the very best and contain only the finest wasabi flavour. Uniquely sweet and dangerously addictive, each and every pea delivers a potent kick to the taste buds. In the land of the rising sun legend has it that the ancient wasabi plant puts fire in your soul. Discovery of its heat would cleanse the mind and purify the body. So as the old proverb goes""Burn bright, breathe Hisaki fire into your soul...""

product.productName: Walkers Sensations Nuts Mexican Smoked Chilli 165g -

No MSG and hydrogenated fats. No artificial ingredients. Not genetically modified. Suitable for vegetarians. Wasabi nuts Asian fire snacks. Hisaki nuts are the very best and contain only the finest wasabi flavour. Deliciously crispy and dangerously addictive, each and every nut delivers a potent kick to the taste buds. In the land of the rising sun legend has it that the ancient wasabi plant puts fire in your soul. Discovery of its heat would cleanse the mind and purify the body. So as the old proverb goes""Burn bright, breathe Hisaki fire into your soul...""

Sharing bag. Suitable for vegetarians. Chinese Szechuan pepper flavour coated peanuts. The spicy citrus tingle of Szechuan pepper gives way to a warming blend of cumin and turmeric. Peanuts covered with a crunchy flavoured wheat and rice flour coating.

Sensational with satay. Thai chilli rice crackers. Those clever Thais have a real knack for a snack. Crunchy, salty, sweet and spicy (all at the same time!), these little rice crackers really are one of the most moreish nibbles we know. We challenge you to stop at one!
